text: <a href="../2-Corinthians-11-1/" title="2 Corinthians 11:1 KJV verse detail"><span id="3" class="versehover">1 Would to God ye could bear with me a little in *my* folly: and indeed bear with me.

<a href="../2-Corinthians-11-2/" title="2 Corinthians 11:2 KJV verse detail"><span id="4" class="versehover">2 For I am jealous over you with godly jealousy: for I have espoused you to one husband, that I may present *you as* a chaste virgin to Christ.

<a href="../2-Corinthians-11-3/" title="2 Corinthians 11:3 KJV verse detail"><span id="5" class="versehover">3 But I fear, lest by any means, as the serpent beguiled Eve through his subtilty, so your minds should be corrupted from the simplicity that is in Christ.

<a href="../2-Corinthians-11-4/" title="2 Corinthians 11:4 KJV verse detail"><span id="6" class="versehover">4 For if he that cometh preacheth another Jesus, whom we have not preached, or *if* ye receive another spirit, which ye have not received, or another gospel, which ye have not accepted, ye might well bear with *him*.
<a href="../2-Corinthians-11-5/" title="2 Corinthians 11:5 KJV verse detail"><span id="7" class="versehover">5 For I suppose I was not a whit behind the very chiefest apostles.

<a href="../2-Corinthians-11-6/" title="2 Corinthians 11:6 KJV verse detail"><span id="8" class="versehover">6 But though *I be* rude in speech, yet not in knowledge; but we have been throughly made manifest among you in all things.

<a href="../2-Corinthians-11-7/" title="2 Corinthians 11:7 KJV verse detail"><span id="9" class="versehover">7 Have I committed an offence in abasing myself that ye might be exalted, because I have preached to you the gospel of God freely?
<a href="../2-Corinthians-11-8/" title="2 Corinthians 11:8 KJV verse detail"><span id="10" class="versehover">8 I robbed other churches, taking wages *of them*, to do you service.

<a href="../2-Corinthians-11-9/" title="2 Corinthians 11:9 KJV verse detail"><span id="11" class="versehover">9 And when I was present with you, and wanted, I was chargeable to no man: for that which was lacking to me the brethren which came from Macedonia supplied: and in all *things* I have kept myself from being burdensome unto you, and *so* will I keep *myself*.

<a href="../2-Corinthians-11-10/" title="2 Corinthians 11:10 KJV verse detail"><span id="12" class="versehover">10 As the truth of Christ is in me, no man shall stop me of this boasting in the regions of Achaia.
<a href="../2-Corinthians-11-11/" title="2 Corinthians 11:11 KJV verse detail"><span id="13" class="versehover">11 Wherefore? because I love you not? God knoweth.

<a href="../2-Corinthians-11-12/" title="2 Corinthians 11:12 KJV verse detail"><span id="14" class="versehover">12 But what I do, that I will do, that I may cut off occasion from them which desire occasion; that wherein they glory, they may be found even as we.

<a href="../2-Corinthians-11-13/" title="2 Corinthians 11:13 KJV verse detail"><span id="15" class="versehover">13 For such *are* false apostles, deceitful workers, transforming themselves into the apostles of Christ.
<a href="../2-Corinthians-11-14/" title="2 Corinthians 11:14 KJV verse detail"><span id="16" class="versehover">14 And no marvel; for Satan himself is transformed into an angel of light.

<a href="../2-Corinthians-11-15/" title="2 Corinthians 11:15 KJV verse detail"><span id="17" class="versehover">15 Therefore *it is* no great thing if his ministers also be transformed as the ministers of righteousness; whose end shall be according to their works.

<a href="../2-Corinthians-11-16/" title="2 Corinthians 11:16 KJV verse detail"><span id="18" class="versehover">16 I say again, Let no man think me a fool; if otherwise, yet as a fool receive me, that I may boast myself a little.

<a href="../2-Corinthians-11-17/" title="2 Corinthians 11:17 KJV verse detail"><span id="19" class="versehover">17 That which I speak, I speak *it* not after the Lord, but as it were foolishly, in this confidence of boasting.
<a href="../2-Corinthians-11-18/" title="2 Corinthians 11:18 KJV verse detail"><span id="20" class="versehover">18 Seeing that many glory after the flesh, I will glory also.
<a href="../2-Corinthians-11-19/" title="2 Corinthians 11:19 KJV verse detail"><span id="21" class="versehover">19 For ye suffer fools gladly, seeing ye *yourselves* are wise.

<a href="../2-Corinthians-11-20/" title="2 Corinthians 11:20 KJV verse detail"><span id="22" class="versehover">20 For ye suffer, if a man bring you into bondage, if a man devour *you*, if a man take *of you*, if a man exalt himself, if a man smite you on the face.

<a href="../2-Corinthians-11-21/" title="2 Corinthians 11:21 KJV verse detail"><span id="23" class="versehover">21 I speak as concerning reproach, as though we had been weak. Howbeit whereinsoever any is bold, (I speak foolishly,) I am bold also.

<a href="../2-Corinthians-11-22/" title="2 Corinthians 11:22 KJV verse detail"><span id="24" class="versehover">22 Are they Hebrews? so *am* I. Are they Israelites? so *am* I. Are they the seed of Abraham? so *am* I.

<a href="../2-Corinthians-11-23/" title="2 Corinthians 11:23 KJV verse detail"><span id="25" class="versehover">23 Are they ministers of Christ? (I speak as a fool) I *am* more; in labours more abundant, in stripes above measure, in prisons more frequent, in deaths oft.
<a href="../2-Corinthians-11-24/" title="2 Corinthians 11:24 KJV verse detail"><span id="26" class="versehover">24 Of the Jews five times received I forty *stripes* save one.

<a href="../2-Corinthians-11-25/" title="2 Corinthians 11:25 KJV verse detail"><span id="27" class="versehover">25 Thrice was I beaten with rods, once was I stoned, thrice I suffered shipwreck, a night and a day I have been in the deep;

<a href="../2-Corinthians-11-26/" title="2 Corinthians 11:26 KJV verse detail"><span id="28" class="versehover">26 *In* journeyings often, *in* perils of waters, *in* perils of robbers, *in* perils by *mine own* countrymen, *in* perils by the heathen, *in* perils in the city, *in* perils in the wilderness, *in* perils in the sea, *in* perils among false brethren;

<a href="../2-Corinthians-11-27/" title="2 Corinthians 11:27 KJV verse detail"><span id="29" class="versehover">27 In weariness and painfulness, in watchings often, in hunger and thirst, in fastings often, in cold and nakedness.

<a href="../2-Corinthians-11-28/" title="2 Corinthians 11:28 KJV verse detail"><span id="30" class="versehover">28 Beside those things that are without, that which cometh upon me daily, the care of all the churches.
<a href="../2-Corinthians-11-29/" title="2 Corinthians 11:29 KJV verse detail"><span id="31" class="versehover">29 Who is weak, and I am not weak? who is offended, and I burn not?
<a href="../2-Corinthians-11-30/" title="2 Corinthians 11:30 KJV verse detail"><span id="32" class="versehover">30 If I must needs glory, I will glory of the things which concern mine infirmities.

<a href="../2-Corinthians-11-31/" title="2 Corinthians 11:31 KJV verse detail"><span id="33" class="versehover">31 The God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, which is blessed for evermore, knoweth that I lie not.

<a href="../2-Corinthians-11-32/" title="2 Corinthians 11:32 KJV verse detail"><span id="34" class="versehover">32 In Damascus the governor under Aretas the king kept the city of the Damascenes with a garrison, desirous to apprehend me:
<a href="../2-Corinthians-11-33/" title="2 Corinthians 11:33 KJV verse detail"><span id="35" class="versehover">33 And through a window in a basket was I let down by the wall, and escaped his hands.
